name: reclothe
content:
Add to word list
Add to word list
to provide someone with new and different clothes: This money will provide clean water for 10 million villagers and reclothe 100,000 street children.
to give something a new covering or outer appearance: My old well-worn books are far more precious to me than copies reclothed in elegant calfskin. Undeterred by his failure, he proposes to reclothe his idea as a new magazine.
More examplesFewer examplesThey re-clothed him in the dress of a servant.After helping to wash and re-clothe the children, she began to prepare dinner.The replanting and rewilding will reclothe the countryside in its rightful form.He bought the house as a ruin and carefully stripped it to its wooden skeleton before he reclothed it.
